254.question: What results do they achieve using their proposed approach?

5-Table2-1.png: They achieve an F-1 score of 54% for OntoNotes and 0% for Wiki(GOLD) in the NER classifier evaluation. For the Wikidata linking step, they achieve an F-1 score of 17% for OntoNotes and 11% for Wiki(GOLD).</s>

256.question: How do they combine a deep learning model with a knowledge base?

4-Figure2-1.png: They combine a deep learning model with a knowledge base by passing the detected entities from the deep learning model into a knowledge base, in this case, Wikidata.</s>

They combine a deep learning model with a knowledge base by first extracting token embeddings from ELMo for the input text. These embeddings are then passed through a residual LSTM module. The final layer of the model detects entities in the text and passes them into a knowledge base, in this case, Wikidata, to retrieve relevant information or relationships.</s>

256.answer: Entities from a deep learning model are linked to the related entities from a knowledge base by a lookup.
